snippet: A deadline to install automated safety features was extended after the industry raised concerns, but a version developed in the 1980s had no takers.
abstract: Pres Obama signs bill giving railroads three-year extension to install automated safety technology, called positive train control, on 60,000 miles of track after industry executives say they need more time to test system; review of studies, interviews and documents, however, reveal that rudimentary form of safety technology, known as Advanced Railroad Electronics System, already existed in 1980s and could have potentially prevented accidents if implemented.
lead_paragraph: A deadline to install automated safety features was extended after the industry raised concerns, but a version developed in the 1980s had no takers.

headline.main: Rail Industry Had Safety Technology Decades Ago
headline.print_headline: Rail Industry Had Safety Technology Decades Ago
